name: Contadina® Hawaiian-Style Pizza
description: Crumbled bacon, pineapple chunks, bell pepper strips and prepared pizza sauce make a quick and tasty pizza.
recipeIngredient: 1 (13.8 ounce) package refrigerated pizza crust dough
6 strips turkey bacon or lean deli ham slices
1 cup Contadina® Pizza Sauce or Pizza Squeeze
1 (20 ounce) can Del Monte® Pineapple Chunks in 100% Juice, well drained
½ cup thinly sliced green or red bell pepper strips
¼ cup sliced green onion or diced red onion

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F.  Spray a large baking sheet with non-stick cooking spray.  Press dough into a 15x10-inch rectangle, and decoratively pinch the edges, if desired.  Bake 8 to 10 minutes or until edges begin to turn light golden brown.
Meanwhile, cook bacon or deli ham until crisp in a non-stick skillet over medium-high heat; crumble and set aside.
Spread pizza sauce evenly over crust.  Sprinkle with cheese and remaining toppings.  Bake 10 to 15 minutes or until cheese is melted and crust is golden brown.

review.reviewBody: I haven't used the chunks for a long time.. I prefer the crushed or Tidbits.... but that is just me. Easy & great simple recipe. And drain the pineapple really well and the ham needs to be blotted if from the package or pizza will be too wet. Also do NOT use a big square cut slice of ham.. slice in in thin strips or again won't blend as well. Just my tried and all that experience. But very quick and very easy to make and oh so delish.

i used this as a base for making our bacon pineapple jalapeno pizza.. we used regular bacon instead of turkey and felt the pizza could have used more.. maybe another 3 slices? one cup of sauce just looked like it was going to make the pizza crust soggy so i only used about 1/2.. i was being lazy and used ragu meat flavored pasta sauce but homemade would have made this much better.. this recipe was kind of skimpy on the cheese (we used colby).. i'd bump it up to 2 cups next time.. i started out using about 1/4 of the can of pineapple but 1/2 would have been perfect.. i ended up cutting the chunks in half and agree with Sheryll & Critters that using crushed or tidbits would be better.. i subbed 2 jalapenos that i deseeded/deveined for the bell pepper.. i wasn't in the mood for onions but i should have put some on bf's half since he loves them.. we did use the cilantro but put it on after the pizza came out of the oven.. bf topped his with some pepperoncinis.. ty for the start of our dinner
